side_events.name: Taiwan Open Government Report Release and Forum
side_events.desc: Come to learn the comprehensive research on the development of open government in Taiwan from 2014 to 2016.
side_events.desc_long: Taiwan Open Government Report is a research project conducted by the Open Culture Foundation in September, 2017 to review the practice and impacts of open government policies in Taiwan from 2014 to 2016. In this report, we focus on four main fields of open government: (1) law and policies, (2) transparency through open data, (3) civic participation, and (4) collaboration through civic technology.
side_events.remind_title: This event will comprise two parts.

remind.remind_desc: The first part is the International Press Release. We will share our findings to the press, international guests, and our government servants.

The second part is a forum. We will invite open government experts and practitioners to have a conversation with our researchers. This forum is open to the general public, and we welcome all engaged citizens to participate in the conversation.

side_events.name: #CodeforGender
side_events.desc: The very first and only Hackathon in Chinese World that aims to use technology to resolve gender issue.
